result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin J Mergenthaler Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) by1-11-2017.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: With any other sentence with credit of 30 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin J Mergenthaler Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Martin J Mergenthaler in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Defendant Martin J Mergenthaler in custody.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Defendant ordered to serve 90 days in the House of Correction concurrent to any other sentence with credit of 30 days time served.  
Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) by1-11-2017.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing. Statements by defense counsel that he had case calendared for 1-11-2016.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court, defendant Martin J Mergenthaler not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defense counse is newly appointed and requests an adjourned plea and sentencing date.  Court grants request.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Martin J Mergenthaler not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing.  Attorney Schoenfeldt also appearing.  Attorney Leija motion to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney Schoenfeldt is now attorney of record.  Defense requests another plea/sentencing date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Martin J Mergenthaler not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing, however, defendant was not produced and defense was unable to proceed. Case adjourned in branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Martin J Mergenthaler not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record.  Defense requests another plea/sentencing date.  Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Martin J Mergenthaler not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be reassigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45 in Room 515 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned to branch 45 for plea & Sentencing at request of defense counsel.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Martin J Mergenthaler in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Martin J Mergenthaler in custody. 
 Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Seifert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.  

Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
